intro: Ribes khorasanicum, commonly known as the Khorasan gooseberry, is a shrub native to Central Asia. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which includes various species of flowering plants in the family Grossulariaceae. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features include simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers.
